main event: A ground visual observation of an oval object in East Danville, Illinois on August 16, 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed moving erratically and was 3-4 times the size of a star., It disappeared to the northwest with no sound., The object was light orange in color and seemed to possess no defined edges., Visibility was good with a bright moon., The report concluded it could possibly be a balloon, aircraft, meteor, or astronomical phenomenon.
